Working with somatic variants

Sean Davis

seandavi@gmail.com

Preliminaries

library(knitr)
opts_chunk$set(cache=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=TRUE)
library(GenomicDataCommons)
library(maftools)
library(SomaticSignatures)

Variant resources at the GDC

Variant resources at the GDC come in two basic flavors, somatic and germline. Germline variants are controlled-access data, requiring dbGaP approval for access. Somatic variants are divided into two subclasses, masked and unmasked. The somatic variants that are “masked” are available as open access data; “unmasked” variants are controlled access and require dbGaP access credentials.

x = files() %>% 
    filter(~ data_category=='Simple Nucleotide Variation' & 
               data_format=='MAF' & 
               access=='open' & 
               analysis.workflow_type=='MuSE Variant Aggregation and Masking') %>% 
    results() %>% 
    as.data.frame()
